title: Economists reconsider the 2% inflation target
description: Despite being firmly established by the US Federal Reserve and the European Central Bank, the figure is increasingly being questioned by many economists.

title: Racially motivated shooter kills three people in Florida
description: A white man in his 20s used a Glock handgun and an AR-15 semi-automatic rifle in an attack in a predominantly Black neighborhood.

title: Zimbabwe: Emmerson Mnangagwa secures second term amidst democratic concerns
description: Zimbabwe's leading opposition party rejected the results of a presidential election that international observers say fell short of democratic standards.

title: Armand Duplantis retains world men's pole vault title
description: On Saturday at the world championship in Budapest, the US-born Swede finished with a best vault of 6.10 meters.

title: Ligue 1: PSG defeats Lens, Marseille bests Brest
description: Kylian Mbappe scored twice as PSG defeated Lens 3-1 at home on Saturday while Marseille jumped to second place after ending visiting Brest's winning start to the season with a lackluster 2-0 victory.

title: Curfew imposed, internet cut as polls close in Gabon
description: Earlier Saturday, the opposition accused the Bongo government of deliberately creating a disorganized election.

title: Popular game show host Bob Barker has died
description: Barker was a household name for a half-century as host of 'Truth or Consequences' and 'The Price Is Right'.

title: Rugby players suffering long-term injuries from concussions want justice
description: Former professionals are stepping up their legal actions to condemn recurrent concussions and the lack of protection for players.

title: Jeano Edwards captures 'everyday beauty' of a Jamaican vacation
description: When photographers explore their roots, their vision is often colored by nostalgia, fantasy, surprise and more. Since 2018, Jamaican-born Jeano Edwards, who left the island at age 16, has spent every vacation roaming the land of his youth.

title: 'Drag Race France' final: 'It's the LGBT community's World Cup'
description: The French version of 'RuPaul's Drag Race' saw Keiona win the season 2 final, with many enthusiastic fans watching together in bars across the country.

title: Sarkozy to face trial over suspected Libyan financing of 2007 presidential campaign
description: The former French president will appear before a criminal court on charges of concealing the misappropriation of public funds, passive corruption, illegal financing an election campaign and criminal conspiracy.

title: Behind the Musk-Zuckerberg fight, the battle between Meta and X rages on
description: The launch of Threads, a direct competitor to X (formerly Twitter), has exacerbated the competition between Silicon Valley's two most famous billionaires.

title: FIFA suspends Spanish football chief Rubiales after Hermoso kiss
description: Spanish soccer federation president Luis Rubiales was suspended on Saturday for 90 days, while a disciplinary committee investigates his conduct at the Women’s World Cup final.

title: Le Monde's selection of five refreshing water gardens
description: Le Monde takes you to superb green locations where water is omnipresent and skilfully staged, from Versailles – of course – to Annevoie in Belgium.

title: Confrontation between France and Niger junta intensifies
description: The coup leaders ordered the French ambassador, Sylvain Itté, to leave the Sahel country within 48 hours, a request rejected by Paris.

title: Spanish federation accuses Hermoso of 'lies' about football chief's kiss
description: Rubiales refused to resign on Friday despite widespread criticism, saying he was the target of a campaign to get rid of him.

title: Canada thrash France as Basketball World Cup tips off
description: The Canadians blew their opponents away with a 95-65 victory.

title: How Prigozhin plane crash wiped out Wagner Group's top leaders
description: Six of the seven passengers on the passenger list of the plane that crashed in Russia on Wednesday are influential, even founding, members of the Russian mercenary group. Le Monde traced them in internal Wagner documents.

title: France's record-breaking heat wave is characteristic of 21st-century climate change
description: The heat wave that just hit mainland France is exceptional both in terms of its late-season nature and its intensity, with more than a hundred temperature records broken. It did not come as a surprise to scientists.

title: Prisons in France grapple with sweltering heat
description: In facilities that are often overcrowded and inadequate in their infrastructure, the recent heatwave is particularly hard to bear for inmates and guards alike.

title: Lithuania, a country at double risk of infiltration
description: 'The new Russian espionage' (5/5). In the Baltic state, intelligence services are constantly on the lookout for activity by Moscow agents or their Belarusian allies, who do not hesitate to conduct propaganda operations.

title: In Canada, Justin Trudeau's personal life takes center stage
description: 'Justin and Sophie's' marital split raises questions about its potential effects on the prime minister's image and the upcoming Canadian political landscape.

title: Sweden faces economic uncertainty
description: With inflation reaching 9.3% in July and interest rates soaring, many economic indicators for the Nordic nation are turning red.

title: US accuses China and Russia of blocking unified UN response to North Korea's missile launches
description: During an emergency Security Council meeting, 13 of the 15 members – all but Moscow and Beijing – condemned Pyongyang's second spy satellite test in three months, which used ballistic missile technology.

title: Gabon: Will Ali Bongo Ondimba rule for another five years?
description: Although weakened by a stroke, Gabon's president is running for a third term on Saturday. His family has ruled this oil-rich state, allied with France, for 56 years.

title: Rugby: South Africa rout New Zealand in World Cup warm-up match
description: The Springboks dominated the All Blacks in historical fashion with a 35-7 victory two weeks before the beginning of the World Cup.
